intro: Baccharis itatiaiae, commonly known as the Itatiaia baccharis, is a shrub native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in humid, subtropical climates. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Baccharis itatiaiae plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various native insects and birds.
